intro: Romulea elegans, commonly known as the elegant romulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, purple or pink blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. It has a bulbous root system and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Romulea elegans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
